description: From Middle English capitoile, capitolie, from Anglo-Norman capitolie or capitoile, Middle French capitole, and Latin Capitōlium (“the Temple of Jupiter in Rome, the Capitoline Hill”), probably from caput (“head”). As a French magistrate, via French capitoul.

entries.meaning: (US) Any building or complex of buildings in which a legislature meets.
examples: The capitol building is located smack-dab in the middle of the state capital.

entries.meaning: (historical) Alternative form of Capitol, the temple of Jupiter on the Capitoline Hill in Ancient Rome.
(historical) Alternative form of capitoul, the former chief magistrates of Toulouse, France.
